business.headline: Adani Green share price jumps 5% today after Q4 business update. Check detailsThe stock rose as much as 5.33% in early trade to hit Rs 941.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At around 1:05 pm, the shares of the company were trading 4.17% higher at Rs 931.

USD vs INR: CA explains which one actually holds more valueCA Nitin Kaushik said that some people argue that salaries in India grow faster. Though he doesn't deny it, he questions whether that trend still holds true today.

Sensex, Nifty jump 6% in two sessions. Are Dalal Street bulls back on track?While the sharp rebound in equity markets has reignited investor enthusiasm, experts are urging caution amid ongoing global uncertainties, especially around the US trade policy.

'Rich Dad Poor Dad' author warns of giant market crash, bets on gold and BitcoinAccording to Robert Kiyosaki the rising gold, silver, and Bitcoin prices show that traditional ways of saving—like stocks, bonds, mutual funds, and ETFs—are no longer safe.

Should you buy HAL, BEL, Mazagon Dock, other defence stocks? Check price targetDefence companies are expected to do well for many positive reasons. These include higher government spending on defence, tensions between countries, a longer list of defence products being made in India, etc.

Explained: Why HDFC share price surged 4% today and what next?HDFC Bank's share price rose as the country's largest private lender, along with several other banks, cut its deposit interest rate by 25 basis points.

IndusInd Bank, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, SBI: Why banking stocks are rising todayShares of IndusInd Bank gained above 6% on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), while HDFC Bank was up 3.3%. Axis Bank shares rose nearly 3% and ICICI Bank was up 2.3%.
Markets in green amid Trump's tariff rowStock market benchmark indices surged on Tuesday as trading resumed following a long weekend, with auto sector stocks leading the gains.

Is Quess Corp share price down over 50%? Not quite, here's what happenedWhat investors are seeing now is the adjusted market value of Quess Corp after the spin-off. The value of the new entities will be discovered once they are listed on the stock exchanges in the coming weeks.

Tata Motors, M&M, Maruti: Why are auto stocks gaining today?Tata Motors led the pack with a gain of over 5%, while Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) climbed nearly 4%. Maruti Suzuki advanced close to 2%, and other prominent names such as Eicher Motors, Bajaj Auto, and Ashok Leyland rose over 1.5%.

Sensex, Nifty rally 2% in early trade. 5 things investors need to knowSensex, Nifty today: Tata Motors led the gains on the Sensex, jumping 5.03% in early trade. Other auto stocks such as Mahindra & Mahindra also performed well, rising 3.74%.
Sensex soars 1,600 points as Trump hints at auto tariff pauseThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,580.01 points to 76,737.27, while the NSE Nifty50 467.30 points to 23,295.85 as of 9:22 am.

entertainment.headline: Ilaiyaraaja sends legal notice to Good Bad Ugly makers over use of his songsLegendary music director Ilaiyaraaja has issued a legal notice to the makers of Ajith Kumar's Good Bad Ugly for using altered versions of three of his iconic songs without permission. He has demanded Rs 5 crore in compensation and the removal of the songs from the recently released action-comedy.

Rapper Lil Nas X suffers partial facial paralysis, shares update from hospital bedRapper Lil Nas X reveals he's lost control of the right side of his face, sharing a video from his hospital bed. Fans express concern as he struggles to smile and speak. Updates on his condition are awaited.
Tamil director-actor SS Stanley dies at 57 in ChennaiPopular Tamil director and actor SS Stanley died at 57 due to health complications. He was undergoing treatment in a private hospital in Chennai.

Nani's dialogue in HIT 3 trailer resonates with fans, draws parallel with real-lifeIn the newly released trailer of HIT 3, Nani's powerful one-liner about survival has struck a chord with fans, who see it as a nod to his journey in the film industry as an outsider.

Sunny Deol recalls visiting Dharmendra on Ankhen sets: There was a tigerSunny Deol shares treasured childhood memories of visiting his father, Dharmendra, on film sets, highlighting the impact these experiences had on him.  He reflects on memorable moments, including witnessing daring scenes and enjoying simple joys during shoots.

Won't stand behind Aamir: Randeep Hooda regrets leaving Rang De Basanti out of egoActor Randeep Hooda shared the story of rejecting 'Rang De Basanti'. He said in a podcast that he blames his 'jaat arrogance' for making that unfortunate choice.

Vivek Dahiya reacts to divorce rumours with Divyanka Tripathi: We are enjoying itVivek Dahiya humorously dismissed divorce rumours with Divyanka Tripathi, sharing that they are simply enjoying the speculation.

Katy Perry says 'no place like home' in first post after space tripKaty Perry shared her first post following her brief trip to space on April 14. The pop star journeyed aboard Blue Origin's New Shephard on an all-female-crewed 11-minute mission on Monday.

Everyone is a He-Man... until the real He-Man arrives ft. Dharmendra. WatchAt 89, Dharmendra exudes incredible strength and spirit to stay healthy and relevant. In his latest video on Instagram, he inspires his fans to make wise health choices. Watch it here.

Johnny Depp is most handsome 'Day Drinker' in 1st look from Marc Webb's filmJohnny Depp is gearing up to make his much-awaited Hollywood feature comeback with Marc Webb's Day Drinker. He will reunite with Penélope Cruz in the upcoming thriller.

Broken leg, table and wheelchair in comedian Vir Das's Air India horror storyComedian and actor Vir Das narrated his experience with Air India in a long social media post. The Emmy-winning artiste explained how his flight with his wife turned into a nightmare due to the airline's complacency.

That's all AI could do: Radhikka Madan claps back at trolls over surgery rumoursRadhikka Madan responded to circulating rumours about her undergoing plastic surgery, which were sparked by a viral AI-generated video. The actor dismisses the claims with humour, urging people to continue their speculation.

Hit show Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah has a new Dayaben, finallyAsit Modi, producer of 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has a new update to share about having new Dayaben on board five years after Disha Vakani left the show.

Sharmila Tagore joins Naadaaniyan criticism: Ibrahim looked good, film didn'tVeteran actor Sharmila Tagore shared her thoughts on her grandson Ibrahim Ali Khan's debut film 'Nadaaniyan'. While she praised his appearance, she felt the film didn't meet expectations.

Good Bad Ugly box office Day 5: Ajith's film on historic run domestically, worldwide Ajith's 'Good Bad Ugly' is creating records for both the actor and the Tamil film industry. The film's Monday business was strong, and it has already become the highest-grossing Tamil film of the year.

Jaat box office Day 5: Sunny Deol's film shows solid hold on 1st MondayAfter recording fabulous business on its first Sunday, Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' didn't disappoint with its Monday collection either. The film is expected to wrap up its first week on an impressive note now.

Never back down: Ranveer Allahbadia uplifts himself in inspiring Instagram postRanveer Allahbadia, also known as The Beer Biceps, shared a heartfelt message on Instagram, emphasising resilience and growth. This follows his recent controversy on India's Got Latent, which led to significant backlash and legal challenges.

Diddy pleads not guilty to expanded indictment: 'These are not new allegations'Sean "Diddy" Combs pleaded not guilty to expanded federal sex trafficking charges. Accused of exploiting women from 2004–2024, Combs denies all allegations. His trial begins in May amid mounting legal scrutiny.

Historic Blue Origin flight: Oprah Winfrey cheers on Gayle King's space journeyOprah Winfrey was emotional as Gayle King overcame her fear of flying to join Blue Origin's historic all-women spaceflight. The moment marked friendship, courage, and a step forward for women in space.

general news.headline: Why say she invited trouble? Supreme Court raps High Court's order in rape caseThe Supreme Court blasted the Allahabad High Court after it granted bail to a person accused of raping a student and said the woman 'herself invited trouble'.

Days after big win over Governor, Tamil Nadu's move to secure more autonomyThe committee, which will be headed by former Supreme Court judge Kurian Joseph, will submit its interim report by January 2026 and the final report within two years.

Once a Waqf, always a Waqf: Congress MLA backs claim on Tamil Nadu village landFresh controversy was triggered after a Dargah sent eviction notices to residents of a village in Vellore, Tamil Nadu, claiming it was part of Waqf board.

Why no Mamata for victims, but mollycoddling of aggressorsEven as Hindus were hacked to death and 400 families fled communal riots in West Bengal after anti-waqf protests turned violent, CM Mamata Banerjee chose appeasement over action. While Mamata and Trinamool leaders have spoken, appealed to and mollycoddled the rioters, they haven't condoled the deaths and devastation.

Dear world, it is 2025 and we live under the tyranny of algorithmsIn the digital world, everything is opaque and constantly changing. And this means that at a time when most of us have our lives intertwined with digital, we are never on a firm footing. We live our lives under the tyranny of "algorithms" crafted by tech companies.

Stay for 3 days, you'll get infected: Nitin Gadkari warns on Delhi air pollutionCiting a medical research, Nitin Gadkari warned that Delhi's pollution can cause infections within days and reduce life expectancy by 10 years.

Bangladeshi actor Meghna Alam arrested in night raid for 'threatening' Saudi tiesThe manner of her arrest has sparked a massive public outcry as the Bangladesh Police took her into custody after raiding her house late last Wednesday night while she was livestreaming on Facebook and claiming her innocence.

Robert Vadra questioned for 3 hours by ED in land deal case, cries 'witch hunt'After leaving the ED office, Robert Vadra claimed that whenever he speaks out against the Narendra Modi government and its policies, the Centre begins misusing central agencies.

Felt like toilet paper: Singapore woman shares employee's brutal resignation noteIn a now-viral LinkedIn post, a Singapore-based businesswoman shared how an employee resigned, saying they felt like 'toilet paper' at their company.

Hospital must lose licence if newborn trafficked: Top court's strict guidelinesThe Supreme Court's tough talk came while it was hearing a case where a stolen baby was delivered to a couple in Uttar Pradesh who wanted a son.

Waqf violence: Is Bengal becoming a theatre of manufactured crises?In the poll run-up looms the grim prospect of complicit communal polarisation, of one party stoking majority anxieties and the other leveraging minority fears

Barack Obama praises Harvard for rejecting Trump's demands: 'Sets an example'Former US President Barack Obama praised Harvard for rejecting Trump's demands to limit campus activism and diversity policies.

Broken leg, table and wheelchair in comedian Vir Das's Air India horror storyComedian and actor Vir Das narrated his experience with Air India in a long social media post. The Emmy-winning artiste explained how his flight with his wife turned into a nightmare due to the airline's complacency.

MS Dhoni reignites pitch controversy: Nobody wants to play timid cricketChennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni reignited the ongoing pitch controversy after their win against Lucknow Super Giants. Dhoni called for better pitches at their home in Chennai where they have lost 3 out of 4 matches.
In Praise of Vargas Llosa, the author whose books changed livesThe Peruvian Nobel Prize winner was the last - and nearly the best - among the titans of 'Boom' literature.
Sensex soars 1,600 points as Trump hints at auto tariff pauseThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,580.01 points to 76,737.27, while the NSE Nifty50 467.30 points to 23,295.85 as of 9:22 am.

Katy Perry says 'no place like home' in first post after space tripKaty Perry shared her first post following her brief trip to space on April 14. The pop star journeyed aboard Blue Origin's New Shephard on an all-female-crewed 11-minute mission on Monday.

Karnataka woman beaten with sticks, pipes after husband's complaint at mosqueSix men were arrested in Davanagere, Karnataka for allegedly assaulting a 38-year-old woman outside a mosque after she was summoned in connection with a domestic dispute involving her husband.

$2.3 billion funding freeze: Trump targets Harvard University over defianceHarvard's USD 2.3 billion in funding was frozen by Donald Trump just hours after the university rejected a list of government demands, asserting that it would not surrender its independence.

Andhra man strangles wife just weeks before she was dueA man in Visakhapatnam killed his pregnant wife, who was just a few weeks away from delivering, in a fit of rage. The two had been married for two years.

Rapper Lil Nas X suffers partial facial paralysis, shares update from hospital bedRapper Lil Nas X reveals he's lost control of the right side of his face, sharing a video from his hospital bed. Fans express concern as he struggles to smile and speak. Updates on his condition are awaited.

Tamil Nadu Governor blasts government over crimes against Dalits in stateTamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi criticised the DMK government's social justice record on the occasion of Ambedkar Jayanti. The Governor highlighted caste discrimination, poor Dalit education outcomes and rising crimes against Dalits as systemic failures in the state.

Radicalised people can't have nuclear weapons: Trump doubles down on IranDonald Trump, who has repeatedly threatened military action if no deal is reached on halting Iran's nuclear program, accused Tehran of 'intentionally' delaying a nuclear deal.

Delhi schools to remain shut for 51 days this summer, from May 11 to June 30The Delhi government has announced summer vacations from May 11 to June 30, 2025, for all government and government-aided schools, as part of the newly released academic calendar.

sports.headline: Bench Maxwell? Who replaces Lockie? Crucial calls await Punjab in KKR clashShreyas Iyer will face his former side on Tuesday, April 15, as Punjab Kings take on Kolkata Knight Riders in Mullanpur, Chandigarh. PBKS are coming off a hammering vs SRH in the last. Will they be able to reset and deliver today?

Sunil Gavaskar's foundation offers Rs 30,000 per month aid to Vinod Kambli: ReportSunil Gavaskar met with Vinod Kambli's doctors in January before instructing his foundation to begin providing financial and medical assistance to the former Indian cricketer. Gavaskar had met the ailing Kambli during the 50th anniversary celebrations of the Wankhede Stadium.

Maxwell has had his run: Doull wants PBKS to bench all-rounder vs KKRAustralian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has been in woeful form in the IPL 2025. Punjab Kings might start thinking about replacing him with either Azmatullah Omarzai or Josh Inglis, feels Simon Doull.

Shreyas Iyer's comeback run in Champions Trophy rewarded with ICC awardStar batter Shreyas Iyer was honoured with the ICC Player of the Month award for March 2025. Iyer top-scored for India in the Champions Trophy, playing a key role in their triumphant run in Dubai.

Watch: Virat Kohli teaches meditation in hilarious segment with Mr. NagsVirat Kohli sat down with RCB's Mr. Nags for a hilarious session of guided meditation. In the segment, Kohli spoke about RCB's chances of winning the title in the 18th year, and how his current relationship is with social media.

Watch: MS Dhoni plays with robot dog, takes it with him after LSG vs CSKCSK captain MS Dhoni took IPL's latest tech - the robot dog - with him after the team's match against LSG. Dhoni, well known for his love of dogs, interacted with the robot dog and played with it after the match.

Noor Ahmad is incredibly tough to read: CSK bowling coachIPL 2025: Chennai Super Kings bowling coach Eric Simmons praised Afghan spinner Noor Ahmad after his incredible four over spell vs Lucknow. Simmons said that he has been coaching for years, but he has never seen someone as difficult to read as Noor Ahamd.

Zen MS Dhoni teaches CSK how cricket should be played: Bowling coachChennai Super Kings bowling coach Eric Simons spoke about the impact of MS Dhoni in the team. Under Dhoni's leadership CSK were able to break the 5-match losing streak and secure a win vs Lucknow Super Giants.

Ravi Bishnoi defends Rishabh Pant for not completing his quota vs CSKIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: In the post-match press conference, leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi defended Rishabh Pant for not completing his quota of four overs despite bowling well in his first three overs against Chennai Super Kings.

Intent, intent and more intent: CSK's new approach under Dhoni finds the winCSK showed intent for the first time in a long time during their win against LSG as their losing streak came to an end. Under MS Dhoni, the players need to keep the new found aggression going to mount a possible comeback in IPL 2025.

Simmons said that he has been coaching for years, but he has never seen someone as difficult to read as Noor Ahamd.

Under MS Dhoni, the players need to keep the new found aggression going to mount a possible comeback in IPL 2025.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
